did.head: Overview of the Records
did.abstract: Carl F. Schmidt (1894-1988) was a local architect who had a keen interest in historic preservation and conservation. The Schmidt Collection includes notes, manuscripts, slides, photographs, pencil sketches and measured drawings created and collected by Schmidt in preparing his many books on historical architecture, which focus primarily on homes in the Genesee Valley area.

descgrp.head: Important Information for Users of the Collection

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access is restricted. Contact Special Collections Librarian to schedule an appointment

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the State University of New York at Geneseo. Literary rights are retained by the creators of the records and their heirs. For permissions to reproduce or to publish, please contact the Special Collections Librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Container number, Carl Schmidt Collection, Milne Library Special Collections, State University of New York at Geneseo, Geneseo, NY.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes two-dimensional drawing, typescript and holograph manuscripts, field notes and drawings, note clippings, black and white photographs, 35 mm. color slides and other collected materials generated by Carl F. Schmidt of Scottsville, New York in preparation for the publication of his books on historical architecture.

did.head: Manuscripts, Notes, and Images
did.physdesc: 68 boxes containing typescript and holograph manuscripts, field notes and drawings, note clippings, black and white photographs, and 35 mm. color slides

did.head: Architectural drawings

daodesc.p: A collection of Schmidt's pencil drawings of regional homes, especially entrance doors, can be found in the New York Heritage digital repository.
